file_content.text: Thanks, Major!
You did it, Major. We're packing our gear and shipping out--it's time to show those Imps how lucky they've been.
I don't know what you did, sir, but we're finally shipping out. And believe me, we're going to make up for lost time.
Stay sharp and fight hard, Captain.
Good luck.
Don't know any other way, sir.
No dumb risks out there, Captain. You don't have anything to prove.
Stay safe.
Understood, sir. We're in this for the long haul, believe me.
The Imps better be having nightmares about you by the end of the week.
Rack up lots of kills!
Consider it done, sir.
Let's get moving, people! Vacation's over!
Good luck, Major.
Major. Captain Marshall, sir, Eighty-first Infantry. It's a real pleasure to meet you.
You must be Senator Evran's reserves.
Likewise.
You mean the "Vacation Brigade"? That's what everyone's calling us, right?
Did you need something, Captain?
Can I help you?
We need to see some action, sir! We've been cooped up here for weeks!
Keep it down, Private. Sorry, Major. We heard a rumor you might be here to get us back into the field. Is that true?
Operational details are top secret, Captain. Sorry.
I can't discuss my mission.
Come on, Major! We're bouncing off the walls here! Give us something!
That's enough, Private! I want a weapons check, armor clean and gear stow in five--move it!
And, Major, if that is why you're here, then good luck. We're all dying to get back out there and crack some Imp skulls. So long.
I'll have you boys on the front lines before you know it.
It's true.
Everyone hear that? We're gonna be back in the fight in no time!
Thank you, Major. We're all dying to put some Imps in our sights again, believe me. Best of luck.
War isn't fun, Captain. Be glad you aren't on the front lines.
Don't be too eager for battle.
With respect, sir, we've seen our share of fighting. It may not be fun, but it's our duty, and we want to do our part.
I won't hold you up any longer, sir. Good luck down there.
I have an important mission to see to, Captain.
I can't talk now.
Yes, of course, sir. I won't hold you up.
Best of luck, Major.
